title: The triall of true friendship or perfit mirror, wherby to discerne a trustie friend from a flattering parasite. Otherwise, A knacke to know a knaue from an honest man: by a perfit mirrour of both: soothly to say; trie ere you trust; beleeue no man rashly. No lesse profitable in obseruing, then pleasant in reading. By M.B.
author: M. B., fl. 1596.
publicationStmtPublisher: By Valentine Simmes dwelling on Adling hill at the signe of the white swanne,
